title: Introducing: Darlings
content:
I’ve been on somewhat of a grungey guitar binge at the moment, what with the mellow-toned Wavering Hands and the scuzzy ‘take no prisoners’ Candy Paint both unleashing ferocious debut tracks over the past couple of days, step up to the plate Darlings, Brooklyn’s latest uber -cool quartet.

Gritty choruses and a slightly lethargic attitude, it’s not clear as to whether they’re about to explode into life mid-song, or collapse into a heap on the floor. Take the 60’s swing of Nothing I Don’t Care For, a track so wonderfully careless that you hardly notice when it slips effortlessly into the Wild Nothing-esque drawl of Pet The Ghost. Now don’t get me wrong, I love Darlings, and for all their energy, it’s quite something that they manage to sound so gloriously and enjoyably apathetic.
